text:
While it didn't resonate with me personally, Kingsman is far from terrible. The James Bond-esque concept is intriguing, and the film delivers on laughs, clever direction, and action sequences, thanks to standout performances from the cast.

Grading: B

This movie wants to do everything. It is a parody, satire, epic summer smash, spy movie, drama, and tale of becoming a man. I know some of that is purposeful, and tongue in cheek. The soundtrack is reused from the Avengers, to which it was much more suited. The combat is ridiculous, which would be fine it this was like Austin Powers or Top Secret!

However this wants to send up spy movies and 'epic' hero movies, but also wants to be that thing it is making fun of. 

A shame as I liked elements of what was done here, but as a whole it is an overbearing mess.
amazing stylish film British spy action fest!

Properly paced, action packed and exciting, Sir Matthew Vaughn’s comic book series makes the leap to film with charm. Embellishing on the hallmarks of the Bond franchise, Kingsman blends extravagant style with arrogance in a playful poke at the spy genre which isn’t afraid to criticize itself or British institutions.

Memeable in its portrayal of the capable gentlemen, this film presents character thru performance. Despite some hiccups mid screenplay, Kingsman is generally relentless in its execution, standing as an example of proper pacing in a motion picture. Kingsman keeps it’s audience glued to the screen, with enthusiasm, lore, spectacle and parody. The absolutely stunning cast (everyone from the protagonist to the extras) keeps it real and relatable in this film. Dialogue is delivered naturally, the script is concise and the narrative surprises. 

With an over the top nefarious villain, an evil lair full of henchman, stylish secret agents, and a narrative that aims to include the next generation of the United Kingdom, Kingsman is nothing short of a modern movie masterpiece; introducing us to the spy genre enjoyably, thru short, meaningful exposition (as well as timely, interesting subplot), while earnestly parodying spy films.

Kingsman is blessed with excellent cinematography, including an incredible fight scene. Jackie Chan's stunt choreographer, Brad Allan, collaborated with Matthew Vaughn to create a seven minute free-for-all. After careful and tedious editing, the resulting three minutes are an almost uninterrupted action sequence which impresses. These kind of “single-take” scenes are uncommon (see the intro in the film Serenity (2005 film)), require extensive effort, but raise film industry standards. The continuous shot gives a complex, fluid, and immersive experience to the melee.

Kingsman manages to blend violence and comedy in an exciting, untroubling fashion. The film is a love letter to classic spy films, and is exceptional in its methodical introduction to a spy agency. This film is rated R, and is best for suited for ages 17 and up.

(I give Kingsman: The Secret Service 9 out of 10 for excellence in the action and comedy genres. A point is deducted for some turbulence in pacing, resulting in some loss of interest.)
A fantastic world with gripping characters and story
Has all the classic spy movie elements and AMAZING visual fight scenes. I seriously CANNOT watch another movie with a fight scene and not think about how Kingsman has upped the game!
Great spy film, even the training part is fun to watch

One of my favorite spy films of all time, Kingsman: The Secret Service delivers with a clear and confident tone, top-notch action scenes, and my favorite performance by Colin Firth. It’s an absolute must-see.

Essentially a comic book version of James Bond, Kingsman embraces its over-the-top style and runs with it. The villain may be more mustache-twirling than truly menacing, but that exaggerated quality fits perfectly within the film’s universe.
While the movie is strong overall, one scene stands above the rest—the infamous church scene. Set to "Free Bird" by Lynyrd Skynyrd, this one-shot action set piece is a masterclass in choreography, pacing, and style. It’s frenetic, brutal, and quite possibly the best one shot I have ever seen. Honestly, I could watch it on a loop forever.

The overarching plot doesn’t break new ground. If you’ve seen a few spy or action films, you’ll likely guess where it’s going. But  Kingsman makes up for with flair, personality and humor. It takes familiar genre tropes and presents them in wildly inventive, stylized ways.
If you’re looking for something visually exciting, genuinely funny, and packed with standout performances and unforgettable action, Kingsman: The Secret Service should be high on that list.
one of the best movie  have ever watch.
Couldn't finish it, Samuel L Jackson's acting was so bad in this and I usually love what he does but not this time.
Fast paced, run and gun spy thriller with excellent camera shots and effects
a loud and proud statement of matthew vaughn's impeccable skill
Impeccable direction and good acting. In addition to the story that keeps you hooked, there is something about the characters that really makes you feel something.

Oh my God, it’s literally so funny. You have to watch it. Amazing writing, fabulous casting, the sets are beautiful, the camera work is amazing, overall a must watch. If you have an issue with really scary movies and you think this might be an issue for you, I really don’t think it will be because although there’s a lot of violence, it’s leaning more towards slapstick and extremist comedy as opposed to just straight gore, and it’s just overall so good. I’m not the biggest fan of super scary things but this was a million out of 10. not scary at all and just such a good watch.
This movie was so much fun to watch! It was action-packed from start to finish and had so many hilarious moments. I definitely recommend it for action fans!
Fun and witty with a lot of amazing action. Absolutely over the top in the best way. James Bond meets Deadpool and it couldn’t be more entertaining.

Una pelicula de espías que explora diversas situaciones y conflictos familiares ademas de abuso y pobreza.

La manera que presentan la historias van explicando como es que maneja la agencia y los adiestramiento me parece que va al paso de la acción y lo que en realidad queremos ver en una película como esta. Mucha acción. Los protagonistas balanceados en sus partes. Sorpresas durante toda la película. 

A pesar que hay ficción no cae en lo ridículo. Se ve bien todo bien presentado.
Cartoonish at times, but still decent. I didn’t like even the suggestion of violence against a dog, but no dog characters were harmed, which made it tolerable.

Kingsman refreshes the spy genre with a youthful twist and a borderline comical yet villainous turn from Samuel L. Jackson. The breakout star, Taron Egerton, conveys a happy-go-lucky persona that evolves into a character who ought to be taken seriously. The trials and tribulations he goes through compose a compelling arc. Not to mention, Colin Firth's caliber is showcased as he deftly exercises his own unique spy etiquette. Their student-mentor relationship is written to great effect.
